View Online <[[{{system.viewAsWebpageLink}}]]> <[[https://www.grandandtoy.com/en/sites/core/default.aspx?cmp=EBBSJUNE19&utm_source={{my.UTM%20Source}}&utm_medium={{my.UTM Medium}}&utm_content={{my.UTM Content}}&utm_campaign={{my.UTM Campaign}}]]> Planning a break over the summer? These simple organizational tips will keep the office running smoothly while you’re away. Co-Worker Collaboration Ensure you brief your colleagues before you leave for vacation. Let them know how long your trip is, and what projects they need to cover during this time. Out-Of-Office-Message Remember to set the auto-reply on your email and update your voice mail message, so people are aware that you’ve taken time off. Include alternate contact details in case of emergency too. Make A List It’s important to switch off when you’re away, so write down your work priorities before you leave, and you’ll know exactly what needs doing on your return, leaving you less stressed. It’s never too soon to start planning your summer vacation, but if you stock up on office supplies now, your return to work will be almost as relaxing as your vacation!
